unnormalised: Someone asked me about registering their new company and what all identifiers they'd need. Well, first things first, you absolutely gotta get a PAN card. It's like, THE most important thing. Think of it as your financial fingerprint, you know? For a company, it's usually under the company's name. You'll need that Permanent Account Number for basically everything, from opening a bank account to filing your taxes. Seriously, don't even think about starting business without a PAN. Plus, keep it safe!
normalised: Someone asked me about registering their new company and what all identifiers they would need. Well, first things first, you absolutely got to get a P-A-N card. It's like, the most important thing. Think of it as your financial fingerprint, you know? For a company, it's usually under the company's name. You will need that Permanent Account Number for basically everything, from opening a bank account to filing your taxes. Seriously, don't even think about starting business without a P-A-N. Plus, keep it safe!

unnormalised: Then, you’ll need a TAN, i.e., Tax Deduction and Collection Account Number. It's a 10 digit alphanumeric number and is required if your company deducts TDS. For instance, if you are paying salaries, you'll be needing to deduct TDS and for that you'll need TAN. Think of it like, you're collecting taxes on behalf of the govt. and TAN identifies you as the collector. Also, GSTIN, which is your Goods and Services Tax Identification Number, is also essential if your business deals with taxable goods or services. Each state has a different code, like 27 for Maharashtra or 07 for Delhi in the GSTIN. So, if your company operates in multiple states, you'll probably need multiple GSTINs.
normalised: Then, you will need a T-A-N, that is, Tax Deduction and Collection Account Number. It's a ten digit alphanumeric number and is required if your company deducts T-D-S. For instance, if you are paying salaries, you will be needing to deduct T-D-S and for that you will need T-A-N. Think of it like, you are collecting taxes on behalf of the government and T-A-N identifies you as the collector. Also, G-S-T-I-N, which is your Goods and Services Tax Identification Number, is also essential if your business deals with taxable goods or services. Each state has a different code, like twenty seven for Maharashtra or zero seven for Delhi in the G-S-T-I-N. So, if your company operates in multiple states, you will probably need multiple G-S-T-I-Ns.

unnormalised: Finally, depending on your business structure, you might need a CIN (Corporate Identification Number). It’s a 21 digit alphanumeric code assigned to companies registered with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA). Also, if you're importing or exporting goods, you'll need an IEC (Import Export Code). It's a 10 digit code. These identifiers are like the keys to running a legit business in India. Getting them sorted early on will save you a whole lot of headaches later, trust me!
